title: I come to a realization: I hate supports that do no damage.
body:
They're frustrating to play with.

Capacity to do damage gives you so many more opportunities.

These supports are actually capable of doing a lot of damage during laning phase with aery. I have seen them do the most damage during the 1st 20 mins of the game.

Not maxing W as Janna and being a lane bully in a lane you can easily get away with it is beyond frustrating. Spelltheifs+Aery+Janna W does an absurd amount of damage in lane compared to the mana cost.

> [{quoted}](name=Venompaw,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BWYyd39i,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-03-29T22:29:42.877+0000)
>
> They&#039;re frustrating to play with.
> 
> Capacity to do damage gives you so many more opportunities.

Nothing worse than a super passive support that sits behind you and occasionally shields.

Supports that can pressure the other ADC, complement my damage and generally fight along side me are what i'm looking for.

The funny thing is this has mostly to do with the player behind the keyboard and not the champ.

Yeah having that Brand is really cool until the Zed kills not only you but then jukes all of Brand's skillshots and autos you to death.

There's a time and place for every support.... not that Brand should be a support, but, you know
I dislike playing with no-damage supports on my team.
I love Soraka both to play with and to play. It's a matter of opinion.
I think the opposite, but alright.

Damage and the potential for damage is its own zoning tool and CC, I was a big fan of fervor Taric when he got reworked because it made him a strong damage threat that could 1v1 carries if they ignored him. Heal bots that can only run away aren't my idea of fun :P
